embeds.title: Reformation
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 :e_slime: / The Slime Boss

Whenever you **Absorb** a Slime, gain 1 **Strength:p_strength:** ( and 1 **Dexterity:p_dexterity:**).

messages.content: The only good use for strength on SB that I know is <liquidate>

embeds.title: Liquidate
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / The Slime Boss

**Unplayable** if you have negative **Strength:p_strength:**.
Lose 2 **Strength:p_strength:**.
Gain 2 (3) **Potency:p_potency:.**

messages.content: Yeah basically
and the aforementioned leech life

So, currently it is extremely good when it comes to filling your Slime slots, and you usually only have one empty slot after playing it, which means that you don't really pick many **Split** cards, as they are rarely useful, which later results in **Absorb** cards also being hard to pick/use.
 After the nerf it will just be a simple **Slime** generator that can always be used to fill your Slime Slots, but will also be somewhat slow which should result in player picking slightly more other split cards, which should also make **Absorb** cards much easier to pick and use.
Why do all the split cards have to exhaust?
well this one won't
eventually
too easy to get extra strength
Scaling needs to be controlled.
Is it? 1 energy for 1 strength isn't really game breaking especially on a character that struggles to utilize it
in practice, apparently so

One thing that I find especially awkward is the fact that taking multiple split cards is kind of discouraged by the fact that whenever you play them if you have all of your slots full the last one will be automatically consumed even if it's a far better slime that the one you're splitting into
Well, Slimes have few flaws when it comes to design, as they are trying to serve similar role that Orbs do, while they also try to be different, resulting in them failing to do both.
I also find specialist slimes inherently flawed as getting one will punish you for using any more splitting cards
i personally like the fact that slimes are more damage-centric than orbs
it's too easy to abuse frost

shame that <Blizzard> kinda sucks

In the meantime I am trying to find an way in which Slimes could do something by themselves, while also being different from **Orbs** (and **Stances**).

Half HP split definitely doesn't fly for a character for a number of reasons.  Enemies go from full to dead every fight, so mechanics only need to work one time.  a gimmick.  As Stanek said, boss mechanics rarely transition well 1-to-1.  On top of that, STS enemies aren't designed to have two targets.  the amount of code rewriting would be vast, and even if done perfectly, downfall would become incompatible with any other mods (we literally just went down this road experimenting with this exact thing on Collector, having Torchheads be actual other characters.  It just doesnt work well without a full scale game redesign)
when you go down that whole road start to finish, you arrive at something like Dupe Form as the most you can do
Yep.
and technically Beaked did predate me.  Beaked was the mod that made me want to mod.

An idea to make **Slimes** different from **Orbs**: what if their effect was "added" to the next Attack you play?
 Of course this would require also having some limits, but it could be an interesting idea.
I think that might be too parallel to Goop, and thus make attacks too critical to all draft builds

There is some inherent value in Slime Boss having simple and/or vanilla-adjacent mechanics being the first character.  It has served us well in onboarding players.  As a baseline rule I don't think uniqueness for the sake of uniqueness is ever a valid standpoint.  This is why I prefer to reprint a card if a design is 99% similar to an existing one instead of having an effectively identical card with a different name and art
In other words it would take both a stellar **and** incredibly easy to understand redesign to make me want to shift away from a proven successful model.
Hexaghost still has a pretty big leap in player onboarding just from adding that new core mechanic.  If Slime Boss had anything similar, I think we'd lose more players on first glance.
Yeah, also reprints are easier to remember.

<Split> reworked:

embeds.title: Split
embeds.description:
Basic Skill / 1 (0) :e_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

**Split** into a random Slime.

messages.content: Pinned a message.
A little more RNG, but it's repeatable. This is an exciting prospect to me.
I think it will be weaker than old split just because the ability to just get 2 slimes (and guarantee a leeching) was really strong.
Glad to see an indefinite way to gain slimes other than <glop chop>

embeds.title: Glop Chop
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 2 :e_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 12 damage.
**Split** into a random Slime ( **Specialist** ).
**Command** 2 (3) times.

messages.content: I do see glop chop falling off hard, since reformation rework meaning the card that gave the most payoff to it is gone, and it also has competition.
Yeah, but you also might want additional ways to generate Slimes because now you will be picking more **Absorb** cards, because they will feel much easier to justify, as you can just get more Slimes.
What other absorb synergy cards are there?
Nothing new, but it should feel much more usable (and consequently much more pickable), due to the fact that now you actually feel like picking additional **Split** cards is going to help you.

Old split was a little too strong for a starter card. Getting just one random slime with this new version will feel pretty weak, but the 0 cost upgrade and removal of exhaust makes it into a much needed support card for the absorb stuff. I will definitely be picking up copies of split:Leeching much more aggressively with this change
I honestly liked old split more, since now it is hard to pull off running with a single slime, since you'll draw split and it's a wasted draw if you don't play it
